channel.title: philstar.com - RSS Headlines
channel.description: Philippine News for the Filipino Global Community

item.title: Hontiveros renews call for suspension of Jolo police force
item.description: "Authorities investigating these two incidents should be provided a free rein so they could conduct an impartial, comprehensive and independent investigation. This is why I continue to call on the PNP leadership to temporarily relieve the entire Jolo, Sulu police force."

item.title: After Duterte pardon, Pemberton lawyer hopes for the US marine's release by Friday
item.author: Kristine Joy Patag
item.description: “I am hoping he would get out by Friday,” lawyer Rowena Flores said.

item.title: DFA confirms death of Filipino crew member of missing cargo vessel Japan
item.author: Bella Perez-Rubio
item.description: "A verification of the remains of the unidentified person found on 04 September 2020 has been made. The deceased was confirmed to be of Filipino nationality," DFA's bulletin read.

item.title: Duterte pardon grant to Pemberton 'solely his own' — Guevarra
item.author: Kristine Joy Patag
item.description: President Rodrigo Duterte’s grant of absolute pardon to US Marine L/Cpl. Joseph Scott Pemberton was solely his decision, Justice Secretary Menardo Guevarra said.

item.title: CHR calls for ‘transparent’ probe into deaths of Parojinog siblings in detention
item.author: Gaea Katreena Cabico
item.description: CHR asked the government to guarantee that the remains of the Parojinog siblings will not be buried until a full and impartial autopsy is conducted.

item.title: DOT moves food and travel fest ‘Kain na!’ online
item.author: Rosette Adel
item.description: The Department of Tourism cooked up the return of its food and travel festival, “Kain na!,” that will now be staged online amid the COVID-19 pandemic.

item.title: Bayanihan 2 signing imminent — Palace
item.author: Alexis Romero
item.description: The Bayanihan 2 bill, which provides additional funds to the government’s pandemic response, may be signed into law next week, Malacañang said yesterday.

item.title: Oil prices lower today
item.author: Catherine Talavera
item.description: Oil firms are implementing rollbacks in the prices of fuel products today.

item.title: Philippines jumps 4 places in latest Global Innovation Index
item.author: Pia Lee-Brago
item.description: The Philippines jumped four places in the latest edition of the Global Innovation Index, putting the country in this year’s top 50 list of innovator economies, the Philippine Mission to the United Nations and other international organizations in Geneva announced.

item.title: Filipino cuisine featured in DFA online show
item.author: Pia Lee-Brago
item.description: Filipino cuisine makes its way to the screens of Filipinos and foreigners all over the world with the launching of the Department of Foreign Affairs online cooking show “Simply Sarap.”
